page.title: 04AYSDALE GATE
page.content: AYSDALE GATE CONSISTS OF ONE DETACHED HOUSE BUILT FOR THE WINDING ENGINEER AT THE MINE, AND A TERRACE OF EIGHT DWELLINGS CONVERTED FROM DISUSED MINE BUILDINGS IN THE 1930'S. THERE IS A FARMHOUSE ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE ARTERIAL ROAD. HERE THE ARTERIAL ROAD RISES STEEPLY AND HAS TWO SHARP BENDS BEFORE THE SUMMIT IS REACHED. THIS SECTION OF THE ROAD IS KNOWN AS BIRK BROW. THE HOUSES FACE DUE EAST AND NESTLE INTO THE FIRST BEND OF THE ROAD. IN FRONT OF THE HOUSES THERE IS AN OLD MINE VENTILLATION SHAFT WHICH IS PLUGGED WITH CONCRETE.
